claims: Cache types are fundamental to understanding caching implementation.
Write-through caches immediately update both the cache and main memory when data is modified.
Write-back caches only update the cache initially and defer updating the main memory until necessary.
fact_usage: Cache types are fundamental to understanding caching implementation.
The two primary cache types are write-through and write-back caches.
Write-through caches immediately update both the cache and the main memory when data is modified, ensuring consistency but potentially slowing write operations.

Write-back caches, on the other hand, only update the cache initially and defer updating the main memory until necessary, improving write performance but risking data inconsistency if not managed properly.
Implementation strategies often involve a combination of different cache types to balance performance and consistency requirements.

Cache Types.score_rationale: The response accurately reflects the provided facts about cache types without introducing unsupported claims.
